Legal_Issue: Whether VRAB erred in refusing to reconsider its decision based on alleged legal error and lack of new evidence
Burden_of_Proof: On applicant (Mr. Bullock) to show error or new evidence
Legal_Rule: Reconsideration allowed under Section 32 of VRAB Act for error in fact, law, or new evidence; CLPA does not apply to VRAB decisions
Procedural_Issue: Applicability of CLPA limitation period to VRAB proceedings
Grounds_for_Claim: Alleged legal error in VRAB decision, failure to apply limitation period under CLPA
Outcome_on_Merits: Claim denied due to lack of evidence linking injury to service
Review_Standard: Error in fact, law, or existence of new evidence under Section 32 of VRAB Act
Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: VRAB followed proper procedures; no procedural unfairness found
Key_Evidence_Considered: Lack of evidence connecting injury to military service
Applicant_Challenge: VRAB failed to apply CLPA limitation period and committed legal error
Legal_Rule_Source: Statutory: VRAB Act s. 32; CLPA s. 32
Defendant_Response: VRAB decisions are not subject to CLPA; no new evidence presented
Remedy_Sought: Order for VRAB to reconsider decision
Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: No statutory time limit for VRAB; CLPA inapplicable
Applicable_Process: Administrative reconsideration followed by judicial review
Outcome_of_Review: Upheld original denial of disability pension
